Finally, got a non-smoking room, which wasn't too good either. Dirty and outworn, smelled bad and the noice from highway just behind the window was unimaginable!! When we checked in I asked the receptionist how early should we arrive to the lobby in order to make it to the shuttle to get us to the airport in the morning. He told us to be there anytime we wanted and in ten minutes the shuttle would arrive. As we arrived in the morning to the lobby and checked out now the other receptionist (who was there at the same time with the evening shift while I was asking in the evening before) told us that the shuttle had already left and there would be no other until after an hour and thus we wouldn't make it to the flight! She didn't offer any help, didn't apologise, even insisted first that she didn't know the guy who was working there with her last evening!!! She was very very rude, and the most unbeliveable thing: while we were standing there the shuttle arrived from it's tour to the airport, but the driver refused to take us to the airport before the next "shift" (in an hour)!! The receptionist didn't make anything for this matter either - infact she took a personal phone call to her mother and started gossiping! We insisted for the taxi, which she (seemed to) order and which never arrived. After 20 minutes I ordered taxi again and thistaxi arrived in five minutes. We made it to the airport barely in time, paid 12 $ for taxi drive even though we selected this hotel partly because of free shuttle service. This seemed though a peanuts then as we were so glad to get out of this horrible hotel beside the horrible highway and run by most rude, non-english-speaking, non-smiling, non-helping and even non truth-telling personnel. We are not picky travellers, we often stay in hostels, budget hotels etc. However, these kind of hotels are not worth the saved bucks: they give you mammoth headaches and bad spirits and possibly a missed flight as an extra surprise. Do yourself a favor and avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a group of 10 students and 3 chaperones. It is the worst place we ever stayed at. The people at the front desk are rude and not helpful at all. The staff is very rude. They actually come in your room without knocking first and don't apologize when they see it is occupied. The rooms are okay, but the cleaning staff is very loud in the morning, forget about sleeping in. The worst part of our stay was the driver of the shuttle. He was the rudest staff member there. Since there were 14 of us, we had to go in 2 seperate groups. He was incredibly rude to the students. When we got to the airport, he gave the other passengers their luggage and yelled at the kids to get their own. Obviously, I didn't tip him. When he picked up the other group, he lied and told them that I said to leave him a tip. Do yourselves a favor, stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good for pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we were going on a cruise out of Miami and needed somewhere to stay for the night. We chose this hotel because it was cheap (62.00 AFTER taxes...we got a good deal online) and also because it offered a free shuttle to the port. We flew in from Ft. Lauderdale, so we didn't use their shuttle service to get to the hotel. We just took a taxi. I actually didn't know they offered a shuttle from the airport. Maybe they only do from the Miami one, I'm not sure. So I can't really comment on their shuttle from the airport. But the shuttle to the port was on-time and went smoothly. If you're staying at this hotel for cruise reasons, it's a good hotel because of the free shuttle to the port. But if you're staying here because you're on vacation in Miami, I wouldn't suggest it. Miami airport is very close nearby and the planes flying overhead are very loud. The highway is also right behind it. Also, the walls are very thin and you can hear everything. Anytime someone closed their door or walked down the hall or even took a shower above you, we could hear it. This didn't bother us, because again, we were only there for a room for the night before our real trip. But it might have bothered us if we were staying there a few days. The hotel does have a bit of a musty smell, and if you get a room on the side that the parking lot is on, you can hear the cars and valet people all night. Course, if you're on the other side, you will be by the highway, and I'm not sure if that would be just as noisey. The room itself was clean, and the king bed was very comfortable. They have a restaurant downstairs. The food was good (we're not too picky when it comes to food, some people might not like it), but it was expensive. We got burgers and fries and it was 9 bucks! They also have a pool, but we didn't go in it. It looked clean though. The staff was nice. The guy at the counter was very friendly. And when we took the shuttle the next day to the airport, our driver was very nice and gave us lots of nice tips for our cruise. One tip about the shuttle to the port: Most cruises let you board their ships at noon. So make sure you get down to the lobby early so that you can board your cruise early. We got down to the lobby at 10:30 for the 11:00 shuttle, and there were already 10 other people there. It was a good thing we already had reservations! If you tell them you want to take the shuttle right when you check in, they will put your name down so you are guaranteed a spot in the morning (as long as you're there on-time). But if you don't put your name down, and get there when 12 people have already put their name down, you have to wait for the next one. And I don't think they do it every hour. I think they have a shuttle at 11, and then the next at 3. But I'm not too sure on that either, it was just something I heard when I booked the room. But better to be safe then sorry, so put your name down right when you check-in. Hope this review helps!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tetons
Reviews.Content: This hotel is dirty, run down, and the clerk at the counter tried to rip me off, my stay was prepaid over 6 weeks in advance by the travel agent, when I arrived at the hotel they had my reservation but said it was not paid for, well after arguing with the clerk for awhile, he said "oh I do see where it has been paid for already". The hallways are old and dark, the neighborhood is crummy, and I was scared to even walk the hallways, it had 1 restaurant with very OVER PRICED food. We had to wait 2 hours for the shuttle to pick us up for the cruise and there is not enough chairs or couches in this dumpy hotel for people to wait for the shuttle to the cruise ship. I will NEVER EVER STAY HERE AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “1st and last time ever”
Reviews.Author: Capt_Otero05
Reviews.Content: I refer to the DAYS INN located at 11th St (there are two others nearby, from the same chain: one at Civic Center; each hotel has its own shuttle; the ones bound for Civic Center and the other one passed more than twice, while the one bound for 11th st has never shown up). The shuttle took almost 2 hours to pick me up. Along these almost two hours, I called the hotel using both the free phone and my own cell phone as well, and could only get messages from an extremely irritant call center. I recorded 5 or 6 urgent messages there. Never had any response for any of them. Finally, when I was about to give up and take a cab on my own, I gave it a last try. A sleepy voice answered and apologized, and said the shuttle would be on its way "immediately". 15 mins later it had not arrived at Concourse E of MIA Intl', so I called again. A 2nd voice (also a sleepy one) answered and said he did not know about the problem, apologized as well and said the shuttle would be "on its way at once". Total time waiting: 01:53 mins. It is quite a record for me, after 26 yrs working with the aviation industry. Apart from that, the ice machine in the corridor was inoperative, though the vending machine was delivering chilled soft drink cans. Rooms & bathrooms are reasonable. Overall, this is one of the few places I would never stay again in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CyndiArm
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel was the free shuttle to the cruise. Also, be aware that there are several Days Inn airport buses. We got on the wrong bus with another couple and then called our hotel and they sent the right bus to transport us. The hotel was filthy. The hallways looked like they had never been cleaned. The non-smoking room smelled like a smoking room. We were afraid to walk barefoot on the carpet. We will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: familyriders
Reviews.Content: This hotel was better than expected. After reading the reviews we were a little worried about the hotel and the shuttle service. Both were great. We called when we arrived at the airport and were picked up about 20 minutes later. We were able to rent a nice convertible at the hotel for about the same price as the airport rental centers. This hotel is not near anything except the highway, so you do need a car if you are staying very long. The city was easy to get around but parking is hard to find. Our room was very large had a microwave and fridge in the room. The room was clean and check in was a breeze. We only stayed one night and returned the car and took the FREE hotel shuttle to the Port with no problems at all. Very nice for the money about $100 a night. As stated in other reviews make sure you pick the right Days Inn as there are many in the Miami area.

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget hotel w/Complimentary Port Shuttle!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Decent for 1 night pre-cruise - which was exactly what we were looking for! Pro: fairly clean, free airport and port shuttles, good-sized room. We stayed Saturday, 10/08/2005, for a rate of appr. $60 through AAA. Probably saved another $50-100 by having the free shuttles as we had 6 people in our party / 2 rooms. Cons: very popular bar 'mystique' draws tons of crowds. We arrived near mid-night w/a toddler in the party and weren't quite sure where we were arriving ;) Breakfast is $7 buffet in the empty / dark bar definately not worth the money, although the service was impecible.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had to stay while visiting my grandfather in Jackson Memorial Hospital. Although it was convenient and cheap, we couldn't stay another night. This hotel was one of the grossest I have stayed in. They put us in a smoking room - didn't really care, except you could tell that the room was never cleaned by the cigarette ashes on the floor and table. We were afraid to walk barefoot and didn't even shower there because you could tell that wasn't cleaned either! It was extremely noisy and even the restaurant was gross. The area does not feel safe, the hospital staff even told us to never go out at night. There are plenty of reasonable hotels downtown that are clean and safe. Avoid this one at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating and helpful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife went on a caribbean cruise and we needed an affordable and convenient hotel for our overnight stay in Miami. We picked this hotel because it had decent tripadvisor reviews and because it offered shuttle services for the airport and seaport. We were very glad we did. Our baggage was lost during one of our connecting flights to Miami and the hotel manager, George, allowed us to use the airport shuttle as much as we wanted to clear up the mess. The rest of the staff was just as helpful and they would always ask if we had found our baggage yet. Anwyays, we eventually found our missing luggage and we couldn't have done it without the generosity of the manager and hotel staff. The rooms, although simple, were clean and tidy. Its not the fanciest hotel, but its definitely one of the best hotels we ever stayed at. Thank you Days Inn.
